part_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement a process that considers each of the following assets and the BES Cyber Systems associated with those assets to identify and categorize the BES Cyber Systems according to their impact on the reliable operation of the BES
implementation_guidance: Review all BES assets; Identify cyber systems associated with those assets; Apply bright-line criteria; Document categorization; Review at least every 24 months
evidence_required: Process documentation; Asset inventory; System categorization list; Bright-line criteria application; Review records
testing_method: Process walkthrough; Documentation review; Interview responsible personnel; Verify categorization logic
compliance_notes: High/Medium/Low Impact designation drives all subsequent CIP requirements

part_description: The process shall include controls to review and update (as necessary) its identifications of BES Cyber Systems and their categorizations at least once every 24 calendar months
implementation_guidance: Establish 24-month review cycle; Document review procedures; Update categorization if changes; Maintain review records
evidence_required: Review schedule; Review completion records; Updated categorization if applicable; Justification for changes or no changes
testing_method: Calendar review; Interview process owners; Verify 24-month compliance; Check update triggers
compliance_notes: Categorization must be reviewed even if no changes; Document 'no changes' decision

part_description: The process shall include controls to review and update (as necessary) its identifications and categorizations of BES Cyber Systems based on the occurrence of a Trigger Event
implementation_guidance: Define trigger events; Establish notification process; Review categorization within specified timeframe; Document trigger event reviews
evidence_required: Trigger event procedures; Trigger event log; Review documentation; Updated categorization if needed
testing_method: Review trigger event procedures; Verify trigger event handling; Check timeliness of reviews
compliance_notes: Trigger events: commissioning new assets; retiring assets; material changes to BES functions

part_description: One or more documented cyber security policies that collectively address the security topics in CIP-003 through CIP-009
implementation_guidance: Develop comprehensive security policy covering CIP-003 through CIP-009; Obtain senior manager approval; Review annually; Distribute to applicable personnel
evidence_required: Security policy document(s); Senior manager approval signature; Annual review records; Distribution records
testing_method: Policy document review; Approval verification; Coverage assessment of CIP-003 through CIP-009 topics
compliance_notes: May be single policy or multiple policies; Must cover all applicable topics

part_description: One or more cyber security plans that include the cyber security controls and procedures to address the security topics in CIP-003 through CIP-009
implementation_guidance: Develop operational security plan(s) implementing policies; Define specific controls and procedures; Document implementation; Maintain and update plans
evidence_required: Security plan document(s); Control descriptions; Procedures; Implementation records; Update history
testing_method: Plan document review; Control verification; Procedure walkthrough; Implementation evidence
compliance_notes: Plans translate policies into actionable controls and procedures

part_description: A CIP Senior Manager by name or title position or office who has overall authority and responsibility for leading and managing the entity's implementation of and adherence to the requirements within the CIP Cyber Security Standards
implementation_guidance: Designate CIP Senior Manager; Document designation; Senior manager must have authority and accountability; Update designation if changes
evidence_required: Designation letter or document; Senior manager name/title; Organizational chart showing authority; Delegation of authority if applicable
testing_method: Interview senior manager; Verify authority level; Review designation documentation; Confirm accountability understanding
compliance_notes: Senior manager cannot be delegated to below executive level; Must have budget and resource authority

part_description: For each of its assets containing Low Impact BES Cyber Systems identify and document Low Impact BES Cyber Systems electronic access points and physical access points
implementation_guidance: Identify all Low Impact BES Cyber Systems; Document electronic and physical access points; Maintain current list; Review and update as needed
evidence_required: Asset and system inventory; Electronic access points list; Physical access points list; Update records
testing_method: Inventory review; Site visits to verify physical locations; Network diagram review for electronic access
compliance_notes: Access point documentation supports R2.3 and R2.4 security controls

part_description: Cyber security awareness programs at least once every 15 calendar months. The program shall be designed to reinforce cyber security practices (which may include associated physical security practices) for the Responsible Entity's personnel who have authorized access to Low Impact BES Cyber Systems
implementation_guidance: Develop cyber security awareness program; Deliver training at least every 15 months; Track completion; Reinforce security practices; May include physical security
evidence_required: Training program documentation; Training materials; Attendance/completion records; Training schedule; 15-month tracking
testing_method: Training material review; Attendance record verification; Interview trained personnel; Verify 15-month cycle compliance
compliance_notes: Awareness not role-specific training; General security practices emphasis

part_description: Physical security controls to restrict physical access to Low Impact BES Cyber Systems to only authorized individuals
implementation_guidance: Implement physical access controls at documented access points; Define authorized individuals; Control and monitor physical access; Maintain access records where feasible
evidence_required: Physical security control descriptions; Authorized personnel list; Access control procedures; Physical access logs if maintained
testing_method: Site visits to verify physical controls; Observe access control operation; Interview security personnel; Verify authorized individual definitions
compliance_notes: Controls proportionate to Low Impact risk; Card readers locks fencing as appropriate

part_description: Electronic access controls for Low Impact BES Cyber Systems with External Routable Connectivity including authentication of users and authorization of user access
implementation_guidance: Determine if External Routable Connectivity (ERC) exists; If ERC implement authentication controls; Implement user authorization; May use authentication through non-programmable means; Define and authorize users
evidence_required: ERC determination; Authentication mechanism description; User authorization list; Access control records; Authentication logs if maintained
testing_method: Test authentication mechanisms; Verify ERC determination; Review authorized user lists; Attempt unauthorized access (controlled)
compliance_notes: Only applies to systems with ERC; Authentication may be simpler than High/Medium; Non-programmable communication devices excluded from authentication if ERC solely through them

part_description: For all personnel requiring authorized electronic and/or authorized unescorted physical access to BES Cyber Systems a process that: Ensures that individuals with such access have had a personnel risk assessment completed within the last seven years
implementation_guidance: Conduct personnel risk assessment; Complete before granting access; Repeat at least every 7 years; Track assessment dates; Document assessment results and authorization decisions
evidence_required: Risk assessment procedures; Assessment records for all authorized personnel; Authorization decisions; 7-year tracking; Assessment dates
testing_method: Personnel file review; Risk assessment verification; Interview HR; Check 7-year compliance for all personnel
compliance_notes: Risk assessment must be identity verification at minimum; May include background checks criminal history

part_description: Training content on CIP Cyber Security Standards related to the individual's job function and role including an overview of the requirements of the CIP Cyber Security Standards
implementation_guidance: Develop initial cyber security training; Deliver before granting authorized access; Cover CIP standards overview; Tailor to job functions; Document training completion
evidence_required: Initial training program; Training materials; Completion records; Training content description; Attendance records
testing_method: Training material review; Completion verification; Interview recently trained personnel; Verify timing before access grant
compliance_notes: Must complete training before first authorized access; Role-based content

part_description: Training content on physical access controls and monitoring systems implemented at the location to which the individual is granted authorized unescorted physical access
implementation_guidance: Develop location-specific training on physical security; Cover physical access controls; Explain monitoring systems; Deliver before access grant; Document completion
evidence_required: Physical security training materials; Location-specific content; Completion records for physical access personnel
testing_method: Training material review; Site-specific verification; Interview personnel with physical access
compliance_notes: Specific to physical security perimeter characteristics

part_description: Training content on the proper use of BES Cyber Systems for which the individual is granted authorized electronic access
implementation_guidance: Develop system-specific usage training; Cover proper use of BES Cyber Systems; Explain do's and don'ts; Deliver before electronic access; Document completion
evidence_required: System usage training materials; Proper use guidance; Completion records for electronic access personnel
testing_method: Training material review; Verify system-specific content; Interview personnel with electronic access
compliance_notes: Must understand proper use before accessing systems electronically

part_description: Verify at least once every 15 calendar months that individuals with active electronic or physical access to BES Cyber Systems or Physical Access Control Systems still require access
implementation_guidance: Establish 15-month access review cycle; Review all active access; Verify ongoing business need; Revoke unnecessary access; Document reviews
evidence_required: Access review procedures; Access review records showing all personnel reviewed; Justification for continued access; Revocation records if applicable; 15-month tracking
testing_method: Access review record verification; Interview access reviewers; Confirm 15-month compliance; Verify revocations processed
compliance_notes: All active access must be reviewed; Document continued business need

part_description: For terminations of individuals with authorized electronic or physical access remove the individual's ability for such access to BES Cyber Systems and Physical Access Control Systems within 24 hours
implementation_guidance: Establish termination notification process; Revoke access within 24 hours of notification; Disable accounts; Collect physical access credentials; Document revocations
evidence_required: Termination procedures; HR notification process; Access revocation records with timestamps; 24-hour compliance tracking
testing_method: Termination record review; Verify 24-hour compliance; Test revocation process; Interview HR and IT personnel
compliance_notes: 24-hour clock starts upon notification to access control personnel; Includes badges accounts and physical keys

part_description: For reassignments or transfers of individuals with authorized electronic or physical access determine whether the individual requires retention revocation or modification of authorized access within seven calendar days of the reassignment or transfer
implementation_guidance: Establish reassignment notification process; Assess access needs within 7 days; Retain modify or revoke access as appropriate; Document assessment and action
evidence_required: Reassignment procedures; Access assessment records; Retention/modification/revocation decisions; 7-day tracking; Documentation of access changes
testing_method: Reassignment record review; Verify 7-day assessments; Interview HR and access managers; Confirm appropriate access adjustments
compliance_notes: Access may be retained modified or fully revoked based on new role
